item.title: New Hourly and Yearly Pricing Mode per VM Type
item.description:
Seller Partner

  • When creating an OMI product and specifying its offer, you can now configure an hourly and yearly pricing mode per VM type. For more information, see Creating and Publishing an OMI Product > Offer.

  • This new pricing mode replaces the On Demand pricing mode (Fixed rate and Rate by VM type).

  • As an organization within the Nuage public (UGAP) market, you can specify a yearly rate by VM type destined to the Nuage public market buyers. For more information, see Creating a Nuage public Offer (UGAP) > Yearly Offer per VM Type).

Buyer

You can now subscribe to an OMI product on the basis of an hourly and yearly offer per VM type. For more information, see Subscribing To an OMI Product and the new OMI Products Pricing page.

Buyer Documentation Update

The information from the Subscribing To an OMI Product, Estimating the Cost of a Product and Requesting an Estimation for a Nuage public Offer (UGAP) pages has been reorganized following the introduction of this new hourly and yearly pricing mode per VM type.

item.title: IAM Update
item.description:
Recovery Codes

All users can now set up recovery codes. These codes can be used as a second factor authentication method to log in to Cockpit v2, in case your preferred multi-factor authentication (MFA) method is unavailable. For more information, see Authenticating Using Recovery Codes.

Password Policy

Additionally to the original requirements of our password policy, new passwords are now gauged on strength. For more information on patterns to avoid, see About Password Protection.

item.title: Cockpit 2.21.3
item.description:
Improvement

  • You can now select a compatible processor generation when allocating a flexible GPU. For more information, see Allocating an fGPU.

item.title: TINA OS Update
item.description:
Unique Identifiers Added to Keypairs

To enhance consistency across our cloud resources and ease their management, keypairs now include a unique identifier (ID) available as a KeypairId attribute in the OUTSCALE API.

The new KeypairId attribute is not a substitute of the current KeypairName attribute. The KeypairName attribute remains fully functional.

Each keypair created receives its ID upon creation.
For existing keypairs, they will be assigned an ID without any impact on your usage.

Tags Added to Keypairs

Keypairs now support the use of tags.

Tags are labels that enable you to categorize your resources and identify them. For example, you can use tags to make inventories of your resources, as you can filter resources that share the same tag. For more information, see About Tags and Adding or Removing Tags.

Behavior of CreateNetPeering (OUTSCALE API)

In the previous TINA OS update, the AccepterOwnerId parameter was added to the CreateNetPeering OUTSCALE API method as optional.

From this update, in the case of sharing a Net peering connection between two Nets belonging to two different users, the AccepterOwnerId parameter is now mandatory.

Starting Virtual Machines (VMs)

We are continuously improving the performances of the OUTSCALE Cloud, especially the duration VMs start times.

The first visible advances are available in this release of TINA OS.

Many more improvements are still on the way in the coming months.

Parameter Removed From the Flexible Compute Unit (FCU) API

In the FCU API, it is no longer possible to get the product types associated to snapshots.

Therefore, the SnapshotId parameter is removed from the GetProductType and GetProductTypes FCU API methods.

item.title: Password Policy Update
item.description: Your password must now be at least 17 characters, on all regions. For more information on the password policy, see About Password Protection.

item.title: Cockpit 2.21.2
item.description:
The following features are now available in Cockpit v2:

OMI

  • You can now import an OMI from a Bucket. For more information, see Importing an Image from a Bucket.

Improvement

  • The Net creation modal has been improved: you can now create and configure the Net associated resources when creating a Net. For more information, see Creating a Net.

item.title: Mistral LLM Services Available for the Nuage public Market (UGAP)
item.description:
Buyer

You can now subscribe to LLM Mistral services offers as a buyer of the Nuage public market (UGAP). For more information, see Requesting an Estimation for a Nuage public Offer > Mistral LLM Service Offer and Subscribing To a Nuage public Offer (UGAP).

item.title: Cockpit 2.20
item.description:
Improvements

  • Tracking cookies have been added for website analytics.

  • Breadcrumbs and sidebar have been added to enhance the navigation experience.

  • Categories have been reorganized.

item.title: Rework of the My subscriptions Page
item.description:
Buyer

The design of the My subscriptions page has been improved to provide a clearer and more concise display of the information related to your subscriptions. This update includes a reorganization of the OMI information, which is now displayed in a side panel where OMI IDs are presented by deployment region and by available versions.

item.title: Mistral LLM Services
item.description:
Buyer

You can now subscribe to Mistral LLM services, which include large language models (LLMs) and the necessary Cloud resources, and deploy these services directly from the OUTSCALE Marketplace interface. For more information, see Subscribing To a Mistral LLM Service and Deploying it.

item.title: Tooling Documentation Update
item.description:
oapi-cli Documentation

oapi-cli is now documented on this website. oapi-cli is the successor of OSC CLI, providing expanded features and improved user experience. For example: better handling of error responses, Bash autocompletion, and a variable system.

This update includes:

  • A Comparison Between OSC CLI and oapi-cli.

  • A page for Installing and Configuring oapi-cli.

  • Tabs for oapi-cli examples in the OUTSCALE API documentation and in the procedures of the User Guide.

Correlation Between OUTSCALE API and Terraform

The OUTSCALE API documentation now also includes tabs for the HCL language, which is used by the OUTSCALE Terraform provider. These tabs contain links to the pages of the corresponding Terraform resources or data sources.

This way, if you are a Terraform user, you can better identify the correlations between OUTSCALE API and OUTSCALE Terraform provider.

item.title: Improved Object Storage Section
item.description: The introductory About section for OOS has been enhanced. To provide a clearer understanding of how the service works, a thorough overhaul of the section has been conducted. This update includes added context, illustrations, and even advice on how to best interact with and make the most of OOS.

item.title: New Subregion
item.description: A new SecNumCloud Subregion named cloudgouv-eu-west-1c is now available. For more information, see About Regions and Subregions.

item.title: Nuage public (UGAP) Market
item.description: 3DS OUTSCALE can now define organizations as belonging to the Nuage public market of the Union des groupements d’achats publics (UGAP). Seller partner organizations can create subscription offers for OUTSCALE machine image (OMI) products, and buyer organizations can subscribe to such offers. For more information, see UGAP’s official website (French only), Creating a Nuage public Offer (UGAP), and Subscribing To a Nuage public Offer (UGAP).

item.title: Subscribing To Microsoft Windows License Offers
item.description:
Buyer

You can now subscribe to Microsoft Windows license offers. For more information, see Estimating the Cost of a Product and Subscribing To an OMI Product > Microsoft Windows License.

item.title: Cockpit 2.19.10
item.description:
The following features are now available in Cockpit v2:

EIM Users

  • You can now update the name, email, and path of a user. For more information, see Modifying a User.

  • As a root user, you can now specify the email of a user at creation. For more information, see Creating a User.

  • The email associated with a user now appears in the EIM Users dashboard.

item.title: EIM Update in OUTSCALE API
item.description:
New Method: ReadEntitiesLinkedToPolicy

You can now get information about all the entities linked to a specific managed policy with the OUTSCALE API method ReadEntitiesLinkedToPolicy. For more information, see Getting Information About Entities Linked to a Managed Policy.

Minor Improvements

  • You can now assign an email address to an EIM user using the CreateUser and UpdateUser OUTSCALE API methods.

  • Pagination and filters are now available for the ReadUser OUTSCALE API method.

item.title: TINA OS Update
item.description:
Appliance in a Net

For security reasons, or because of the capacity of your software solutions, you might want to delegate the control of network traffic to an appliance.

To do this, you can send all external network traffic to a VM running an appliance.

You can follow this tutorial to set up an appliance: Setting Up an Appliance in a Net.

Matching Behavior Between CreateNetPeering (OUTSCALE API) and CreateVpcPeeringConnection (FCU API)

The PeerOwnerId parameter of the CreateVpcPeeringConnection FCU method is now added to its corresponding OUTSCALE API CreateNetPeering method under the name AccepterOwnerId.

This integration is done in two steps:

  1. In this version, the AccepterOwnerId parameter is added as optional in the OUTSCALE API. It is included in this release to enable users and tools to integrate it as of now.

  2. In a future version, this parameter will be mandatory in the case of sharing a Net peering connection between two Nets belonging to two different users.

Consistency of the IsSourceDestChecked Parameter

In the OUTSCALE API, the value of the IsSourceDestChecked parameter in the primary Network Interface Card (NIC), with 0 as device index, is now consistent with the IsSourceDestChecked parameter of the VM.

This improvement is also applied in the Flexible Compute Unit (FCU) API with the sourceDestCheck parameter of the Flexible Network Interface (FNI) that is consistent with the sourceDestCheck parameter of the instance.

item.title: Cockpit 2.19.9
item.description:
The following features are now available in Cockpit v2:

EIM Users

  • You can now update the name and path of a user. For more information, see Modifying a User.

Improvements

  • The resource details view can now be displayed fullscreen.

  • Interface buttons, dialog boxes, and form fields have been modernized.

  • The total number of resources is now displayed on every dashboard, next to the documentation link, as follows: .

item.title: Improved Display of API Responses and Nested Elements
item.description:
The layout of the API documentation has been improved:

  • Nested request parameters and nested response elements are now indicated by vertical lines and nodes, instead of indent symbols (») previously.

  • In the response part of each method, the response 200 elements are now directly listed, instead of only having a link to the response schema.

  • When there are more than one examples for a response, the first example is visible by default while the other examples are enclosed in expandable blocks.

item.title: Recommended VM Definition
item.description:
Seller Partner

The definition of recommended virtual machines (VMs) when creating an OUTSCALE machine image (OMI) product has been improved. For more information, see Creating and Publishing an OMI Product > Offer.

item.title: Pagination Tutorial
item.description: The Tutorial: Paginating an API Request page has been updated to include the pagination method for OUTSCALE API calls pertaining to policies, users, and user groups.

item.title: OUTSCALE Marketplace Updates
item.description:
Business Provider Contract

When creating an outsourced product, you must now read and accept the business provider contract in order to publish the product. For more information, see Creating and Publishing an Outsourced Product > Contractual terms.

Operating System Selection

When creating an OUTSCALE machine image (OMI) product and specifying the Versions form, you must now select the operating system from a list and provide details on it. For more information, see Creating and Publishing an OMI Product > Versions.

item.title: Cockpit 2.18
item.description:
The following features are now available in Cockpit v2:

EIM Groups

  • Creating a Group

  • Deleting a Group

EIM Policies

  • Attaching a Managed Policy to a Group

  • Detaching a Managed Policy from a Group

Load Balancers

  • Adding or Deleting Listeners

  • Configuring Health Checks

  • Enabling Access Logs

Load Balancers Improvements

  • You can now configure new options when creating an internet-facing load balancer in the public Cloud, such as the privacy, the public IP, and the Subregion. For more information, see Creating an Internet-facing Load Balancer in the Public Cloud.

  • You can now configure new options when creating an internet-facing load balancer in a Net, such as the privacy, the load balancer type, the public IP, the Subnet, and the security group. For more information, see Creating an Internet-facing Load Balancer in a Net.

  • You can now configure listeners, health check, access logs, and backend VMs when creating an internal load balancer. For more information, see Creating an Internal Load Balancer.

Other Improvements

Dashboards routing has been updated. You need to replace any previously bookmarked URLs.

  • You can now release an fGPU linked to a VM. For more information, see Releasing an fGPU linked to a VM.

  • You are now provided with an estimation of the VM cost type when creating a VM. For more information, see Creating VMs.

item.title: Estimating the Cost of a Product on Several VMs
item.description:
Buyer

You can now estimate the cost of using an OMI product on several virtual machines (VMs). For more information, see Estimating the Cost of a Product.

item.title: New Sync Feature in OOS Documentation
item.description: The OUTSCALE Object Storage (OOS) documentation now includes the sync command. For more information, see Synchronizing Objects to a Bucket.

item.title: License Agreements of BYOL and Free/Open Source OMIs
item.description:
Seller Partner

When creating an OMI product whose pricing mode is bring your own license (BYOL) or free/open source, you must now specify a link to the product’s license agreement in the Legal section. For more information, see Creating and Publishing an OMI Product > Legal.

Buyer

When subscribing to an OMI product whose pricing mode is bring your own license (BYOL) or free/open source, you can now view the license agreement of the product in the My subscriptions page. For more information, see Subscribing To an OMI Product.

item.title: TINA OS Update
item.description:
CPU Performances

CPU performance has been improved across all our Regions.

The placement of vCores of new virtual machines has been optimized, through better support for NUMA (non-uniform memory access) zones in Intel processors.

Network Performances

The network performance has been improved across all our Regions.

For the newly created Nets, the network can now handle a larger number of packets per second, and bandwidth capacity has been increased.

Fixes and Minor Improvements

  • In the RouteTable methods of the OUTSCALE API, the GatewayId parameter can now return the local value.

  • In the OUTSCALE API, the creation of a Net peering between a Net you own and a Net that belongs to another account has been fixed.

  • You can no longer use outscale-elb-sg as the name of a security group. This name is reserved to OUTSCALE’s usage.

  • The performance of the FCU API DescribeInstances method has been improved. You can now get information from a larger number of VMs simultaneously.

item.title: New Release Notes Page
item.description:
For better visibility, the release notes for all the products and services of the OUTSCALE Cloud are now presented on a new page.

On this new page, each entry is categorized with tags on the left column, and you can use the menu on the right to filter the entries by tags.

The release notes from before June 17 are still located in the older pages:

  • Documentation History (Old Page)

  • API Release Notes (Old Page)

  • Cockpit v2 Release Notes (Old Page)

  • OUTSCALE Marketplace Release Notes (Old Page)
